lead_paragraph: The Yankees right-hander Joba Chamberlain allowed two runs and two hits in five and a third innings in his final spring training start Sunday. Chamberlain, pitching for Class AA Trenton in a camp game against Class AAA Scranton/Wilkes-Barre, retired 16 in a row — five by strikeouts — after allowing two hits and a walk to start the game. ¶The season opener between the Kansas City Royals and the host Chicago White Sox on Monday has been postponed a day because snow is in the forecast, the first time weather has postponed the White Sox’ opener since 1982. snow.
